description:
**Tool Overview**: 

A PowerShell command used to hide desktop icons in Windows 11. This command modifies the registry to change the visibility of desktop icons, providing a cleaner and more organized workspace. 

**Details**: 
This command is particularly useful for users who want to declutter their desktop by removing unnecessary icons without permanently deleting them. The command interacts with the Windows registry under the key `HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\HideDesktopIcons`. By setting specific properties, users can toggle the visibility of their desktop icons. 

**Example Command**: 
```powershell
Set-ItemProperty -Path 'HKCU:\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\HideDesktopIcons' -Name 'Desktop' -Value 1
``` 
This command would hide all desktop icons. To make them visible again, replace the `-Value` with `0`.
